snippet.title: Crikey Worm: gay marriage showdown, Ian Narev admits 'mistakes'
snippet.content:
WHAT TURNBULL NEEDS
Another Monday, another bad Newspoll result for the Prime Minister, with the Coalition still trailing Labor 47-53 in two-party preferred terms, . However, Malcolm Turnbull's lead as preferred prime minister has grown to its highest level this year, with 46% of Australians preferring Turnbull and just 31% preferring Opposition Leader Bill Shorten. And there's another public scolding for Turnbull , which commissioned Ipsos to conduct focus groups in Melbourne and Sydney about Turnbull's performance. The results: unanimously bad, with respondents saying the PM had "sorely disappointed" them. "He just needs to grow, pardon me, balls," one Sydney voter told the group.
